content: AI just psychoanalyzed my socks‚Äîand it was disturbingly accurate.üé® The AI Game That Knew Me Better Than My LinkedIn Profile!Check out this ridiculously simple way to spark creativity, connection, and maybe a few laughs with your colleagues and family - while Discovering AI (yeah - learning disguised as fun).Try this: üì∏ Snap a photo of anything around you.Then ask your favorite LLM (ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.): ‚ÄúWhat makes this piece of art interesting?‚Äùüí• The kicker: This isn‚Äôt about the right answer. It‚Äôs about the conversations that happen afterwards.üß© This is how we move from consumers to creators.Try it today at work. It‚Äôs fast. It‚Äôs free. And try it with your family too! Think of it as dinner conversation‚Ä¶ upgraded.üëâ Post your art photo here and share this post. comments.content: Socks have always been a core part of my ‚Äúfun side‚Äù signature corporate look. When I worked for NetApp, my team had this custom-made artwork created for me. It‚Äôs me, sitting at a Parisian caf√©, in funky socks, with my dachshund by my side. A total vibe check, captured in a line drawing. So when AI nailed my socks as an art expression, it showed the breadth of insights that can be derived from human behavior patterns.This also provides a great opportunity for me to give a shout-out to my colleagues at NetApp who were so thoughtful and kind in giving me this custom piece of art. Emily Miller Jeremiah Glodoveza Alex Lin-Goldsmith Jodi Baumann Carole Lloyd Lisa Love Bebb Roger Villareal Christine / Chris Heckart

comments.content: Wow‚Ä¶I did not expect the AI to come for my personality!I tested it on this shot of my boots & here's part of what it said:What makes this image interesting as a piece of everyday art lies in its blend of contrast, context, & subtle expression:1. Unexpected Contrast: The polished, formal black Chelsea boot & suit pant leg are paired with bright, playful socks. The socks feature bold graphics & binary text‚Äîelements typically associated with tech or digital culture‚Äîintroducing an unexpected juxtaposition to an otherwise classic outfit.2. Hidden Personality: Socks are often the most expressive part of a formal outfit, offering a glimpse into the wearer's interests or personality. The binary-style pattern & digital motif signal tech-savviness, curiosity, or humor‚Äîtransforming something ordinary into a statement.3. Textural Harmony: The photo captures several textures all layered with visual balance. 4. Modern Work Culture Commentary: The photo could subtly reflect the blending of professional & personal identity in modern workplaces. Even in a buttoned-up environment, individuals often find ways to express themselves‚Äîsometimes as simple as through their socks.Nailed me with 1, 2, & 4hashtag#CreateMoreConsumeLess

comments.content: Sorry to hear of the passing of Dick Kramlich, HBS grad known for being a pioneering venture capitalist and co-founder of New Enterprise Associates (NEA). He was also well known for wearing colorful, distinctive socks. This became something of a signature style element for him. In the sometimes formal world of finance and venture capital, his colorful sock choices were a memorable personal touch that stood out. (photo from Jim Simmons post https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jamespsimmonsjr_very-sad-to-hear-of-the-passing-of-dick-kramlich-activity-7293000956521197568-ehuM?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAAd1fABbnkl28608xFcvnjEwA2qF6bYbLI) hashtaghashtag#NeverTakeYourselfTooSeriously hashtaghashtag#BeYou hashtaghashtag#DriveImpact
